text:
This problem recently posted on EE. Haven't found any official comments about 
this behavior, but it seems to happen from time to time.

http://www.apache-httpd.com/msg/5190.html
http://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=28260&edit=2
creator: techtonik@tut.by
jorton@redhat.com
text:
Well, Ilia says it's a PHP misconfiguration, so unless there's reason to believe
there is an httpd issue here, marking as invalid.
